parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural

str2: A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The Greek form of the Hebrew name: Jerusalem. Of Hebrew origin; Hierosolyma

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: From peri and pateo; to tread all around, i.e. Walk at large; figuratively, to live, deport oneself, follow.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Neuter of hieros; a sacred place, i.e. The entire precincts of the Temple.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
High priest, chief priest. From arche and hiereus; the high-priest; by extension a chief priest.
From gramma. A writer, i.e. scribe or secretary.
Comparative of presbus; older; as noun, a senior; specially, an Israelite Sanhedrist or Christian 'presbyter'.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural

str2: To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
